intro: Tridentea dwequensis, commonly known as the desert trident, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and water-storing tissues. It plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing food and habitat for local wildlife. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
